definition: step with the left foot (Kangxi radical 60)/see also 彳亍[chi4 chu4]

up here, down there (idiom); to rise and fall in succession/no sooner one subsides, the next arises/repeating continuously/occurring again and again (of applause, fires, waves, protests, conflicts, uprisings etc)
know yourself, know your enemy (idiom, from Sunzi's "The Art of War" 孫子兵法|孙子兵法[Sun1 zi3 Bing1 fa3])
lit. to attend to one thing and lose sight of another (idiom)/fig. to be unable to manage two or more things at once/cannot pay attention to one thing without neglecting the other
to favour one and discriminate against the other
either this or that/one or the other
to make no distinction between what's one's own and what's another's (idiom)/to share everything/to be on very intimate terms
to rise and fall in succession (idiom)/repeating continuously

pinyin: Ka3 te4 bi3 le4 gong1 si1

definition: no better (or worse) than each other/both in the same boat

sentences.english: Peter answering said, The Christ of God.
sentences.chinese: 彼的回答说，是神所立的基督。

sentences.english: He went to Pilate, and begged the body of Jesus.
sentences.chinese: 这人去见彼拉多，求耶稣的身体。

sentences.english: I must down to the seas again, to the lonely sea and the sky.
sentences.chinese: 余须复适彼沧海，复共空寥之海天。

sentences.english: What is that herb by the path?
You see, these Bodhisattvas Mahasattvas are able to obtain great benefit.
sentences.chinese: 汝观彼诸菩萨摩诃萨，善获利益。

sentences.english: Pilate therefore said unto him, Art thou a king then?
sentences.chinese: 彼拉多就对他说，这样，你是王吗。

sentences.english: What shall I do, then, with Jesus who is called Christ?" Pilate asked.
sentences.chinese: 彼拉多说，这样，那称为基督的耶稣，我怎么办他呢。

sentences.english: Here are two sets, a and b: either one or the other.
sentences.chinese: 这里有两个集合，甲与乙，非此则彼。

sentences.english: Pilate therefore, willing to release Jesus, spake again to them.
sentences.chinese: 彼拉多愿意释放耶稣，就又劝解他们。

sentences.english: 12That day Herod and Pilate became friends--before this they had been enemies.
sentences.chinese: 从前希律和彼拉多彼此有仇，在那一天就成了朋友。

sentences.english: Then said Pilate to the chief priests and to the people, I find no fault in this man.
sentences.chinese: 彼拉多对祭司长和众人说，我查不出这人有什么罪来。

sentences.english: Ignorant people believe his ravings and lose their original resolve.
sentences.chinese: 彼无知者，信是虚诳，遗失本心。

sentences.english: In that context, he mentions Christus who was put to death by Pontius Pilate.
sentences.chinese: 书中，他还提到基督在彼拉多手下被处以死刑。

sentences.english: All formed from the four treasures and for this reason named 'Ultimate Bliss'.
sentences.chinese: 皆是四宝周帀围绕，是故彼国名为极乐。

sentences.english: There was an old Stupa which was damaged with brambles and grass.
sentences.chinese: 于彼园中有古朽塔摧坏崩倒荆棘掩庭蔓草封户。

sentences.english: John is one storke above Jack in the contest.
sentences.chinese: 约翰在比赛里胜彼一筹。

definition: classical final particle, similar to modern 了[le5]
one's old self/one's original self/what one has always been
